JobFullDesc: About The Role: Uber Eats is seeking a Strategy & Operations Manager to help define and facilitate the future of work of delivery people in Australia and New Zealand. As part of Uber Eats' Marketplace team, this new role will have a dedicated focus of defining and improving the overall experience of delivery people on our platform. This will be an important and highly visible role, partnering closely with a gamut of cross-functional teams, including  Legal, Policy, Product, Operations and Customer Support to drive meticulous planning and rapid execution of initiatives.What You’ll Do: Be a passionate advocate for all members of our delivery people community and listen intently to their feedback, so we can positively influence how we engage with them, and provide meaningful insights to the rest of the company that directly impacts how Uber works.Define and lead our efforts to improve the experience of delivery people and their benefits on our platform, partnering closely with our Legal and Policy teams to sculpt the future of work in a rapidly evolving landscapeIdentify, establish and own specific subject matter areas as a key point of contact for any related cross functional issues or projectsDevelop, coordinate and lead projects from their initial definition until their final implementation. You will also be responsible for defining and following project important metrics. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with many different teams across the business, ensuring alignment and attention to detail - all while maintaining Uber's high standards for operational execution.Data analysis: Uber wouldn't be Uber without all of our data. You will autonomously build your own analyses to measure your projects' success.Build processes and tools to optimise the experience and benefits of delivery peopleWhat You'll Need:A proven track record: 3+ years of business management, policy operations or legal/regulatory experience in a dynamic environmentA self-starter who thrives in ambiguity: Defining the future of work on our platform isn’t easy, and there isn’t an existing plan for you to follow. You’ll have the support of your manager, broader team, and cross-functional partners, but you’ll need to be the one driving this forward and setting the paceA willingness to ‘get into the weeds’ and a continuous improvement attitude: You won’t get it right on day 1, or week 1, or month 1… However, by being in the detail and deeply understanding all aspects of our product and processes, you’ll be best placed to advise and/or execute on improvement opportunitiesCross-functional stakeholder management: You’ll need to engage and obtain agreement from stakeholder, including the leadership team across the organisation You enjoy working in a fast-paced environment and are comfortable with ambiguity.
